BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: WALNUT HILL SCHOOL FOR THE ARTS

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO EDUCATE TALENTED, ACCOMPLISHED AND INTELLECTUALLY ENGAGED YOUNG ARTISTS FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD. THE SCHOOL DOES SO IN A DIVERSE, HUMANE AND ETHICAL COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF WALNUT HILL IS TO EDUCATE TALENTED, ACCOMPLISHED AND INTELLECTUALLY ENGAGED YOUNG ARTISTS FROM ALL OVER THE WORLD. THE SCHOOL DOES SO IN A DIVERSE, HUMANE AND ETHICAL COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: INSTRUCTIONAL EXPENSES RELATED TO EDUCATING STUDENTS IN GRADES 9 THROUGH 12 WHILE AT SCHOOL. THE SCHOOL ENROLLED APPROXIMATELY 294 STUDENTS DURING THE FALL AND SPRING SEMESTERS. WALNUT HILL STUDENTS IMMERSE THEMSELVES DEEPLY IN THEIR ART, GUIDED BY HIGHLY ACCOMPLISHED PROFESSIONAL ARTISTS WHO HAVE DEDICATED THEMSELVES TO SUPPORTING YOUNG PEOPLE ON THEIR ARTISTIC JOURNEYS. THIS TIME SPENT MASTERING AN ARTISTIC DISCIPLINE IS BALANCED BY ENGAGEMENT IN A RIGOROUS COLLEGE-PREPARATORY CURRICULUM THAT CHALLENGES STUDENTS TO ASK BIG QUESTIONS, SOLVE COMPLEX PROBLEMS, AND EXPLORE TRADITIONAL ACADEMIC SUBJECTS THROUGH INNOVATIVE, HANDS-ON LESSONS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: STUDENT ACTIVITIES, THEATER AND MUSIC PRODUCTIONS, TUTORING, DORM LIFE AND FOOD SERVICE AND STUDENT CLUBS. THE SCHOOL ENROLLED APPROXIMATELY 294 STUDENTS DURING THE FALL AND SPRING SEMESTERS. OF THE 294 STUDENTS, APPROXIMATELY 223 STUDENTS LIVED ON-CAMPUS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: SUMMER AND OTHER PROGRAM EXPENSES FOR UNENROLLED STUDENTS, SUCH AS THE COMMUNITY ARTS PROGRAM. THE SUMMER PROGRAMS ENROLLED APPROXIMATELY 201 STUDENTS AMONG MANY DIFFERENT PROGRAMS SUCH AS DANCE, VISUAL ARTS, MUSIC, WRITING AND THEATER.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: DIR. OF ADMISSIONS/ ASST. HEAD OF SCHOOL

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO LIFE BENEFICIARIES OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS INCLUDES SCHOLARSHIP, FINANCIAL AID, FACULTY DEVELOPMENT, INVESTMENT IN PLANT AND VARIOUS OPERATIONAL NEEDS.
NET REALIZED & UNREALIZED GAIN ON SWAP 6,335. FINANCIAL AID -3,829,663. CAPITAL CAMPAIN EXPENSES -41,929.
PUBLISHED NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN REGIONAL NEWSPAPERS

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: PARENT MEETINGS, PROSPECTIE STUDENTS AND FUNDRAISING MEETINGS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FUNDS AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES REPRESENT FINANCIAL AID WHICH IS APPLIED BY THE SCHOOL DIRECTLY TO THE TUITION CHARGES OWED TO THE SCHOOL. THE INDIVIDUAL DOES NOT DIRECTLY RECEIVE THESE FUNDS.
THE METHOD USED TO ACCOUNT FOR EXPENDITURES DISCLOSED IN THIS SCHEDULE IS THE ACCRUAL BASIS, CONSISTENT WITH THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GAAP.

THE ORGANIZATION USES FINANCIAL RECORDS FOR ALL FAMILIES THAT REQUEST ASSISTANCE AND UTILIZE THE SCHOOL AND STUDENT SERVICES (SSC) PROVIDED BY NAIS TO HELP DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE REQUIRED BY A FAMILY. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE USING THE SSC CALCULATION, FINANCIAL RECORDS, AND ANY OTHER INFORMATION AVAILABLE.
FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S OUTSTANDING TUITION BILL. CASH PAYMENTS ARE NOT MADE DIRECTLY TO RECIPIENTS.

THE SCHOOL REQUIRES THAT THE HEAD OF SCHOOL LIVE ON CAMPUS IN SCHOOL PROVIDED HOUSING. IT IS NOT CONSIDERED A TAXABLE BENEFIT AS THE HOUSE IS AVAILABLE TO CONDUCT SCHOOL BUSINESS IN, EVEN IF THE HEAD IS NOT THERE. IN ADDITION, WHILE THE HEAD IS IN THE HOUSING, HE IS AVAILABLE TO ASSIST THE NEEDS OF THE SCHOOL SHOULD THEY ARISE OUTSIDE OF NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. DUE TO THE RESIDENTIAL COMPONENT OF THE SCHOOL, IT IS CRITICAL THAT THE HEAD BE AVAILABLE AND PRESENT AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. THE SCHOOL OWNS A JEEP THAT IS RESERVED FOR USE BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. THE CURRENT HEAD OF SCHOOL ALSO OWNS AN AUTO THAT IS USED FOR PERSONAL USE. WHILE USING THE SCHOOL'S JEEP, THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS AVAILABLE FOR SCHOOL BUSINESS VIA PHONE OR EMAIL. ANY USE OF THE SCHOOL'S JEEP WHILE THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS NOT AVAILABLE IS TO BE REPORTED TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO PAY OFF THE 2002 & 2006 SERIES BONDS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE $13,070,511 IS MADE UP OF $11,645,000 WHICH WAS USED TO REFINANCE THE 2002 AND 2006 PREVIOUSLY ISSUED BONDS AND $1,425,511. THE $1,425,511 WAS USED FOR FACILITY IMPROVEMENTS AND EXPANSION PROJECTS.

LoansBtwnOrgInterestedPrsnGrp.LoanPurposeTxt: ALLOWS THE HEAD OF SCHOOL TO PUT A DOWN PAYMENT ON A HOUSE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE L, PART II, LOANS TO AND FROM INTERESTED PERSONS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL ISSUED A PERSONAL LOAN TO THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IN THE AMOUNT OF $90,000. THE WRITTEN AGREEMENT INCLUDES A STATED INTEREST RATE OF 6% (OR, IF LOWER, THE MAXIMUM RATE ALLOWABLE BY LAW) WITH PAYMENT TERMS OVER 10 YEARS. THE LOAN WILL BE DUE IN FULL IN THE EVENT EMPLOYMENT BETWEEN THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND THE SCHOOL IS TERMINATED FOR ANY REASON. THIS TRANSACTION WAS APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IS STILL REQUIRED TO LIVE ON CAMPUS IN ACCORDANCE WITH HIS EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT.

THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS FOR "SECURITIES- PUBLICLY TRADED" REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO DONATED SECURITIES. THE NUMBER OF CONTIRBUTIONS FOR THE "VARIOUS AUCTION ITEMS" REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED FOR THE AUCTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY HAVE NOT RECEIVED A COPY OF THE 990 PRIOR TO ITS FILING. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS APPOINTED THE RESPONSIBILITY OF OBTAINING AND REVIEWING THE FORM 990 TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE FORM 990, IN ITS ENTIRETY (WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SCHEDULE B), AND REVIEWED IT FOR COMPLETENESS AND ACCURACY, PRIOR TO IT BEING FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT THAT INDICATES THAT THEY HAVE READ, UNDERSTOOD AND AGREE TO THE SCHOOL'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. FURTHER, THE TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS (AS DEFINED IN THE POLICY) AND/OR NOTIFY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL IF ANY ADDITIONAL ISSUES ARISE THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THE POLICY IS ENFORCED AND MONITORED BY THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND/OR THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. TRUSTEES WHO FAIL TO COMPLETE THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORM ARE ASKED TO VERBALLY CONFIRM THE INFORMATION IN THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT AND ALSO DISCUSS ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS AT THE NEXT BOARD MEETING. AT JUNE 30, 2016, THE POLICY APPLIED ONLY TO TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WILL DETERMINE COMPENSATION FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL AND OTHER OFFICERS USING THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: 1. THE TRANSACTION IS APPROVED BY AN AUTHORIZED BODY OF THE ORGANIZATION, WHICH IS COMPOSED OF INDIVIDUALS WHO DO NOT HAVE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST CONCERNING THE TRANSACTION. 2. PRIOR TO MAKING ITS DETERMINATION, THE AUTHORIZED BODY OBTAINED AND RELIED UPON APPROPRIATE DATA AS TO COMPARABILITY. 3. THE AUTHORIZED BODY ADEQUATELY DOCUMENTS THE BASIS FOR DETERMINATION CONCURRENTLY WITH MAKING THAT DETERMINATION. THE DOCUMENTATION WILL INCLUDE: -THE TERMS OF THE APPROVED TRANSACTION AND THE DATE APPROVED; -THE MEMBERS OF THE AUTHORIZED BODY WHO WERE PRESENT DURING DEBATE ON THE TRANSACTION THAT WAS APPROVED AND THOSE WHO VOTED ON IT; -THE COMPARABILITY DATA OBTAINED AND RELIED UPON BY THE AUTHORIZED BODY AND HOW THE DATA WAS OBTAINED; -ANY ACTIONS BY A MEMBER OF THE AUTHORIZED BODY HAVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST; AND -DOCUMENTATION OF THE BASIS FOR THE DETERMINATION BEFORE THE LATER OF THE NEXT MEETING OF THE AUTHORIZED BODY OR 60 DAYS AFTER THE FINAL ACTIONS OF THE AUTHORIZED BODY ARE TAKEN AND APPROVAL OF RECORDS AS REASONABLE, ACCURATE AND COMPLETE WITHIN A REASONABLE TIME THEREAFTER. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST UTILIZED IN THE SPRING OF 2015 TO DETERMINE THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S SALARY. IT RESULTED IN A MULTI- YEAR CONTRACT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAKES THESE DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
